name: Transmission Of Security Parameters
description: The information system reliably associates security parameters with information exchanged between information systems.
supplemental_guidance: Security parameters include, for example, security labels and markings. Security parameters may be explicitly or implicitly associated with the information contained within the information system.

rev5.name: Transmission of Security and Privacy Attributes

attack_techniques.name: Server Software Component
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Reliable association of security parameters with exchanged information ensures that server software components processing data maintain proper security labeling, detecting unauthorized modifications to data handling by malicious server components.

attack_techniques.name: Encrypted Channel
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Transmitting security parameters alongside encrypted communications enables receiving systems to validate the expected security classification and handling requirements of data within adversary-mimicked encrypted channels.

attack_techniques.name: Transport Agent
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Security parameter association with email transport data ensures that transport agents processing messages maintain proper security labeling, detecting malicious transport agents that strip or modify security markings.

attack_techniques.name: Symmetric Cryptography
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Associating security parameters with symmetric encrypted communications enables detection of improperly labeled C2 traffic by verifying that security classifications match expected parameters for encrypted data exchanges.

attack_techniques.name: Asymmetric Cryptography
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Transmitting security parameters with asymmetric encrypted data enables receiving systems to validate expected security markings, detecting adversary encrypted channels that lack proper security parameter associations.
